class.name: Vector2i
class.brief_description: Vector used for 2D math using integer coordinates.
class.description: 2-element structure that can be used to represent positions in 2D space or any other pair of numeric values. It uses integer coordinates and is therefore preferable to [Vector2] when exact precision is required. [b]Note:[/b] In a boolean context, a Vector2i will evaluate to [code]false[/code] if it's equal to [code]Vector2i(0, 0)[/code]. Otherwise, a Vector2i will always evaluate to [code]true[/code].

method.name: Vector2i
method.description: Constructs a new [Vector2i] from the given [code]x[/code] and [code]y[/code].

method.name: Vector2i
method.description: Constructs a new [Vector2i] from [Vector2]. The floating point coordinates will be truncated.

method.name: abs
method.description: Returns a new vector with all components in absolute values (i.e. positive).

method.name: aspect
method.description: Returns the ratio of [member x] to [member y].

method.name: sign
method.description: Returns the vector with each component set to one or negative one, depending on the signs of the components.
